channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A Devastating Fire Has Fueled a National Security Crackdown in Hong Kong
item.description: The authorities quickly arrested critics demanding accountability, signaling an expansive use of the security law to silence dissent over nonpolitical...

item.title: China does not need Nvidia chips in the AI war — export controls only pushed it to build its own AI machine
item.description: If the U.S. wants to lead in AI, chip controls are not the answer.

item.title: Boeing’s new CFO sees ‘performance culture’ driving a return to positive cash flow next year
item.description: Jay Malave joined the Fortune 500 company in August.

item.title: Exclusive: Former Citadel employees raise $17 million for Fin, a global stablecoin app ‘without all the complexity’
item.description: The startup aims to allow businesses to conduct big cross-border transactions in cheap and rapid fashion.

item.title: L’Oreal CHRO cut her teeth at luxury brands Chanel and Kiehl’s—like Walmart’s CEO she says the secret to her success was always saying yes
item.description: Like Walmart’s CEO, L’Oreal exec says the the secret to her success was always saying yes—to grabbing coffee, taking notes, moving abroad

item.title: Fund managers from diverse backgrounds are delivering standout returns and the smart money is slowly starting to pay attention
item.description: Since 2016, we’ve invested through diverse fund managers, seeing steady, market-rate performance. An entrenched "old-boy" network keeps us in the mino...

item.title: After Deadly Attacks, Australia Debates: Do Shark Nets Work?
item.description: Critics say the nets harm marine life and aren’t the best way to keep swimmers safe. Recent shark attacks have complicated a plan to remove some of th...

item.title: Private Employers Cut Jobs in November, in Latest Sign of a Slowdown
item.description: Data from ADP, a payroll processor, is getting added attention because of delays in official statistics caused by the government shutdown.

item.title: Bitcoin’s Sky-High Prices Have Not Panned Out
